name: Muslim American Society of Greater LA
mission: TO MOVE PEOPLE TO STRIVE FOR GOD-CONSCIOUSNESS, LIBERTY AND JUSTICE, AND TO CONVEY ISLAM WITH UTMOST CLARITY
theoryOfChange: The Muslim American Society (MAS) outlines its strategic framework under the 'Our Impact Areas' section of its website. This framework details five key focus areas: Islam to Muslims, Leadership Development, Community Mobilization, Social Justice, and Islam to Non-Muslims. For each focus area, the organization specifies 'Subareas of Focus,' which describe their activities, and corresponding 'Outcomes,' which represent the anticipated changes or results. For example, under 'Leadership Development,' MAS aims to 'Empower a new generation of leaders' through activities like training, equipping, and supporting, with expected outcomes of increased 'Capacity' and 'Influence.' This structured approach, linking activities to desired outcomes, functions as an impact framework or logic model, explaining how their programs are intended to create impact.

all_citations.claim: MAS Greater LA maintains a program expense ratio of 77.3% and reports total revenue of $832,882.
The organization is zakat-eligible and follows specific asnaf categories for distribution.
Financial records confirm fundraising efficiency of $0.03 per $1 raised and working capital of 3.6 months.
MAS programs address critical youth issues and provide community-based support structures.
all_citations.source_name: Here is the full paper from Young Muslims.

all_citations.claim: The organization offers multiple giving methods for donors to support its mission of liberty and justice.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 65/100 score due to its strong alignment with religious values and efficient fundraising, though its overall rating is tempered by low data confidence and limited financial reserves.
areas_for_improvement: Limited data transparency resulting in a low data confidence score.
Working capital reserves are relatively low at 3.6 months.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for Muslim donors as a zakat-eligible institution focusing on religious and cultural urgency [2][6]. Its mission to promote liberty and justice through the Tarbiya & Youth Ministry (TYM) aligns with the core needs of the American Muslim community[5].
dimension_explanations.impact: MAS Greater LA demonstrates a direct impact through its youth and advocacy programs, maintaining a program expense ratio of 77.3% [1][3]. While the organization provides direct provision of services at a cost of approximately $124.45 per beneficiary, the low data confidence score suggests a need for more robust third-party verification of long-term outcomes[5].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Muslim American Society of Greater LA empowers the community through spiritual development, youth mentorship, and civic advocacy.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 77.3%, indicating the majority of funds directly support community services.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.03 per $1 raised.
Verified zakat-eligibility for donors seeking to fulfill religious obligations.
baseline_narrative.summary: The Muslim American Society of Greater LA (MAS Greater LA) is a non-profit organization dedicated to moving people toward God-consciousness and justice through clear Islamic education [1]. The organization operates as a zakat-eligible entity, providing direct services through its Tarbiya & Youth Ministry and Public Advocacy & Civic Engagement programs [2][3].

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects a <cite id="21">clear theory of change</cite> but a lack of <cite id="17">external impact evaluations</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: MAS Greater LA uses a <cite id="21">clear theory of change</cite> focused on Tarbiya (spiritual education) and civic engagement to create a God-conscious society.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that spiritual and youth programs are effectively meeting the needs of the community.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="5">120.8% revenue growth rate</cite>, the organization is rapidly scaling its community services.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="6">77.3% of its expenses toward programs</cite> and spends only <cite id="7">$0.03 to raise every dollar</cite>.
Operating since <cite id="2">1993</cite>, MAS Greater LA has a <cite id="11">33-year track record</cite> of delivering youth and advocacy services.
The charity has achieved a <cite id="5">3-year revenue CAGR of 120.8%</cite>, indicating a high capacity to scale its impact.

strengths_deep_dive: MAS Greater LA distinguishes itself through a lean operational model that maximizes donor impact. By maintaining a <cite id="6">77.3% program expense ratio</cite>, the organization ensures that every dollar contributed is accounted for within its service delivery frameworks, such as the <cite id="12">Tarbiya & Youth Ministry</cite>. Furthermore, its <cite id="13">working capital of 3.6 months</cite> provides a resilient financial cushion, allowing for sustained operations even during economic fluctuations. This financial stability is complemented by a <cite id="14">77.3% independent board</cite>, which provides critical oversight for its <cite id="15">$832,882 in annual contributions</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Muslim American Society of Greater LA (MAS Greater LA) is a community-focused organization established to <cite id="1">convey Islam with utmost clarity</cite> while promoting spiritual development and civic justice. Founded in <cite id="2">1993</cite>, the organization has spent over three decades building a robust infrastructure for <cite id="3">youth mentorship and public advocacy</cite> within the Southern California region. Financially, the organization has demonstrated significant growth, reporting <cite id="4">total revenue of $832,882</cite> in the 2023 tax year, which represents a <cite id="5">3-year revenue CAGR of 120.8%</cite>. This rapid expansion is paired with a high commitment to direct service delivery, as evidenced by a <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 77.3%</cite> in its most recent filings. MAS Greater LA operates with high efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="7">fundraising efficiency of $0.03 per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of donor contributions are utilized for its core mission of <cite id="8">God-consciousness and community service</cite>. The organization is <cite id="9">verified as zakat-eligible</cite>, specifically serving the <cite id="10">fisabilillah category</cite> to support its educational and advocacy initiatives.
